summary: The 'Preventing Sexual Abuse of K–12 Students Act of 2025' amends the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to protect students from sexual abuse. It mandates states to establish and implement policies requiring local educational agencies to develop codes of conduct and provide training for school personnel on preventing sexual abuse, reporting child abuse, and understanding Title IX. The bill also provides funding for these training programs and requires the Secretary of Education to submit a report to Congress on the incidence of sexual abuse and recommendations for prevention.
